wikipedia_page.main: Simon David Myles (born 2 June 1966) is a former English - Hong Kong cricketer who played for Hong Kong. Myles was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm medium pace. He was born in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire.

response: *Most runs in an innings: 172 (Simon Myles, Hong Kong v Gibraltar, Bridgnorth, 1986)

A completely one-sided match saw Bermuda amass 304/9 (Arnold Manders 75) and then bowl out Fiji for just 69, with two men bowling unchanged throughout: A Edwards took 6-38 while T Burgess claimed 4-29. The USA's total of 152 looked vulnerable as Derek Abraham picked up 4-27, but Canada collapsed in reply and were dismissed for 79, Kamran Rasheed taking 4-22. An ICC Trophy record 172 from Simon Myles, who put on 174 for the third wicket with Nigel Stearns (62) guided Hong Kong to 324/5, and 63 from Gibraltar's Gary De'Ath made no difference to the result as they finished on 180/5, 144 runs adrift. The Netherlands won another one-sided game as they made 271/6 (RE Lifmann 98, RJ Elferink 64) and then ran through Papua New Guinea's batting, Paul-Jan Bakker taking 5-18 as PNG were bowled out for a mere 52.

response: Lifmann made his senior debut for the Netherlands in September 1978, playing against the New Zealanders returning from their tour of England.Miscellaneous matches played by Robert Lifmann – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. His first international tournament for the Netherlands was the 1982 ICC Trophy in England.ICC Trophy matches played by Robert Lifmann – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. At the tournament, Lifmann scored 250 runs from four matches, ranking him fifth in the competition for runs (and first among his teammates).Batting and fielding in ICC Trophy 1982 (ordered by runs) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. His highest score, 155 not out, came against Malaysia,Malaysia v Netherlands, ICC Trophy 1982 (Group B) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. and set a new tournament record for the highest individual innings (later broken by Hong Kong's Simon Myles).ICC Trophy highest individual innings – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. Lifmann remained in good form at the 1986 ICC Trophy, scoring 395 runs from ten matches to rank third among Dutch batsmen and fifth overall.Batting and fielding in ICC Trophy 1986 (ordered by runs) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 21 February 2016. His tournament included scores of 98 against Papua New Guinea and 110 against Israel, as well as a team-high 41 in the final against Zimbabwe. Lifmann was a regular for the Netherlands for several more years, playing his last international in 1989 (against the Australians returning from their tour of England). His club cricket was played for VOC Rotterdam.
